ontologyFramework.OFDataMapping

Interface OFDataMapperInterface<OntoEntity extends org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLObject,R>

  • Type Parameters:
    OntoEntity - Ontological entity to map
    R - Java Object to map
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BooleanDataMapper, ExceptionDataMapper, FileDataType, FloatDataMapper, IntegerMapper, ProcedureDataMapper, StringDataMapper, TimeLine, TimeStampDataMapper, TimeWindowsDataMapper

    public interface OFDataMapperInterface<OntoEntity extends org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLObject,R>
extends java.io.Serializable
    This class defines the method that must be created into a class to define a one to one Mapper between an Ontological entity and a Data Type. This allows to standardize the methods for all the mapper that can be used in the framework. By default they are created from OFDataMapperBuilder and stored in OFBuildedListInvoker.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Buoncomapgni Luca

      Replace the value of an ontological entity in atomic way.
      void setKeyWords(java.lang.String[] kw)
      this method is called from OFDataMapperBuilder.buildInfo(String[], OWLReferences, ontologyFramework.OFRunning.OFInvokingManager.OFBuildedListInvoker) and should be used to store internally the name of interesting data represented in the ontology.

    • Method Detail

      • mapFromOntology

        R mapFromOntology(OntoEntity entity,
                OWLReferences ontoRef)
        Get informations from the ontology and returns a Java Object
        Parameters:
        entity - ontological entity from which retrieve informations.
        ontoRef - OWL reference to the ontology
        Returns:
        a Java Object which represent the ontological entity mapped in a Java data type

      • mapToOntology

        boolean mapToOntology(OntoEntity entity,
                    R value,
                    OWLReferences ontoRef)
        Store informations given as java Object into the ontology. It returns true if success.
        Parameters:
        entity - ontological entity to create, delete or modify into the description
        value - java Object which represent the data in a particular data-type to be added into the ontology
        ontoRef - OWL references to the ontology
        Returns:
        true if the operation is successfully completed

      • removeFromOntology

        boolean removeFromOntology(OntoEntity entity,
                         R value,
                         OWLReferences ontoRef)
        Delete from the ontology a particolar entity that is represented by the given Java Object.
        Parameters:
        entity - ontological entity to delete (if it exists) from the description
        value - java Object which represent the data in a particular data-type to be added into the ontology
        ontoRef - OWL references to the ontology
        Returns:
        true if the operation is successfully completed

      • replaceIntoOntology

        boolean replaceIntoOntology(OntoEntity entity,
                          R oldArg,
                          R newArg,
                          OWLReferences ontoRef)
        Replace the value of an ontological entity in atomic way. Which means that, given an ontological entity E with a particular property A. The method will assign to A the new value and will remove the old one with no possibilities for the reasoner to update the data structure during those operations. Note that E is given as input while A should be encoded in the implementation of the interface.
        Parameters:
        entity - ontological entity for which replace the values
        oldArg - value to remove
        newArg - value to add
        ontoRef - OWL references to the ontology
        Returns:
        true if the operation is successfully completed

      • setKeyWords

        void setKeyWords(java.lang.String[] kw)
        this method is called from OFDataMapperBuilder.buildInfo(String[], OWLReferences, ontologyFramework.OFRunning.OFInvokingManager.OFBuildedListInvoker) and should be used to store internally the name of interesting data represented in the ontology. Those data are setted in the ontology itself and are used all the time the mapper is called.
        Parameters:
        kw - words used in the ontology
